content:
IRemoteMethodInfoContract Interface

Definition

Defines a contract that components can use to access information about a method across application domain and process boundaries.

In this Article

public interface IRemoteMethodInfoContract : System.AddIn.Contract.IContract

Remarks

An IRemoteMethodInfoContract represents a method of a remote object that implements the IRemoteObjectContract interface.

To access one or more methods of a remote object, use the GetRemoteType method to get an IRemoteTypeContract that represents the type of the remote object. Then, call the GetMethod or GetMethods method.

Methods

GetMethodData()

Returns information about the method that this IRemoteMethodInfoContract identifies.

public System.AddIn.Contract.Automation.RemoteMethodData GetMethodData ();
Returns
RemoteMethodData

A RemoteMethodData that provides information about the method that this IRemoteMethodInfoContract identifies.

Remarks

The information provided by the RemoteMethodData structure includes the types of the method's return value and parameters.

Invoke(IRemoteObjectContract,BindingFlags,IRemoteArgumentArrayContract,Int32)

Invokes the method that this IRemoteMethodInfoContract identifies.

public System.AddIn.Contract.RemoteArgument Invoke (System.AddIn.Contract.Automation.IRemoteObjectContract target, System.Reflection.BindingFlags bindingFlags, System.AddIn.Contract.Collections.IRemoteArgumentArrayContract parameters, int localeId);
target
IRemoteObjectContract

The IRemoteObjectContract that identifies the object that contains the method to invoke.

bindingFlags
BindingFlags

A bitwise combination of the BindingFlags values that specifies how to invoke the method.

parameters
IRemoteArgumentArrayContract

An IRemoteArgumentArrayContract that specifies the method parameters; null if the method does not have any parameters.

localeId
Int32

The locale ID that the method will use for any locale-specific type conversions of the arguments or return value.

Returns
RemoteArgument

A RemoteArgument that specifies the return value of the invoked method.

Remarks

If the invoked method does not have a return value (for example, the method is a constructor), Invoke returns a default RemoteArgument in which the RemoteArgumentKind property is set to the value System.AddIn.Contract.RemoteArgumentKind and the TypeCode property is set to the value System.TypeCode.
